results.title: Gil and Liz Hopkins
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gil and Liz Hopkins have lived in Laharum, in western Victoria, for over 30 years. They raised three children there, built their own home, which is nearly completely self-sufficient, with solar panels and reclaimed water. Their hope is to leave the land in better shape than they found it and they’re taking their knowledge to the community to help others do the same.
results.description: Gil and Liz Hopkins have lived in Laharum, in western Victoria, for over 30 years. results.title: An Olive Grove in Laharum
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Toscana Olive Plantation and Laharum Grove, in western Victoria, both operate from the same original plantation of olives, working together to ensure the freshness, quality and flavour of their oil. While they acknowledge Laharum is a peaceful place to live, the workers at these olive farms are hectic, determined to produce some of the best quality olive oil in Victoria.
results.description: Toscana Olive Plantation and Laharum Grove, in western Victoria, both operate from the same original plantation of olives, working together to ensure the freshness, quality and flavour of their oil. results.title: Clarrie's Ranch
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Jessica Scott, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Clarence ‘Clarrie’ Mackley has built his own patch of paradise, a small ranch devoted to Slim Dusty, Elvis and all things country and western. Living by his ethos of ‘do what you wanna do’, Mackley attracts tourists from all over to the world to his colourful place in Horsham, western Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Matt Blackwood, Jessica Scott, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

results.title: Horsham Greyhounds
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the people that work at the greyhound races every Tuesday afternoon at Horsham, in western Victoria. Mostly volunteers, they assist the dogs and their owners from vets checks to wash downs, ensuring that Horsham Greyhounds remains the safest race in Victoria.

results.title: Horsham's Op Shop Ladies
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the women who volunteer their time to run Horsham’s Op Shops, located in western Victoria. These ladies have been providing years of entertainment and bargains to both locals and visitors, embodying the community spirit of Horsham.

results.title: At the Foot of the Arapiles
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.
results.description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.
description_for_label: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.

results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dave Jones is an animator who moved to Natimuk about 2001, follow him as he works on an ambitious live projection project involving a 14 metre high puppet, which will be suspended from the town grain silos.

results.title: The Natimuk Rock Climbers
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Louise Shepherd and Keith ‘Noddy’ Lockwood reminisce, tell anecdotes and reveal what makes a “mountain goat” tick, and how Mt Arapiles, in western Victoria, has shaped Natimuk’s destiny as an international destination for climbers.

results.title: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge
results.brief_description:
Mark Rosenthal, curator of the ‘William Kentridge: Five Themes’ exhibition, joins world renowned artist and filmmaker William Kentridge in conversation days before the official opening of the exhibition. Kentridge talks about becoming an artist in the apartheid era of South Africa, how he developed his art practice and the importance of the studio as a place for safe stupidity.

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.
results.title_for_label: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.

results.title: Twin [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Lee and James Ruse Agricultural High
results.brief_description:
‘Twin’ is a videogame that highlights the importance of self-respect. It is based upon the Hero’s search for those who took away his ‘colour’. As his colour has been taken away, he has been reduced to his black and white form; his own being is split into two. The Hero realises his colour was in fact not stolen and by being able to overcome the puzzles and challenges brought by each level, the Hero begins to respect himself and is ultimately able to retrieve his ‘colours.’

A 2D problem solving/puzzle showing respect starts with self. This trailer illustrates how the game is played.
Under the category ‘Secondary Games’, James Ruse Agricultural High School’s Nicholas Lee, Year 12, was the Screen It 2011 winner.
